intro: Euonymus baekdusanensis, commonly known as the Baekdusan euonymus, is a flowering plant native to the Korean Peninsula. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by three-lobed, red or orange berries that are visually striking. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
